rule.name: Use print
rule.description:
The lack of visibility could confuse developers.

To reduce redundancy, it is recommended to use less functions and target more appropriate ones. It makes the code clearer and simpler. In this case print is suitable.

Noncompliant Code Example 

putStrLn (show x)

Compliant Solution 

print x

rule.description:
The lack of visibility could confuse developers.

To reduce redundancy, it is recommended to use less functions and target more appropriate ones. It makes the code clearer and simpler.

Noncompliant Code Example 

flip (>=>)

Compliant Solution 

(<=<)

rule.name: Use zipWithM_
rule.description:
The function zipWithM_ is more appropriate to ensure optimisation, you should use it to make the code more forceful.

While using this function, the redundancy is reduced too, that increases the code readability and it becomes easier and simpler to maintain.

Noncompliant Code Example 

sequence_ (zipWith f x y)

Compliant Solution 

Control.Monad.zipWithM_ f x y

rule.name: Use guards

The lack of visibility could confuse developers.

To reduce redundancy, it is recommended to use less functions and target more appropriate ones. It makes the code clearer and simpler.

Noncompliant Code Example

Compliant Solution 

foo a b | fii b = a | faa a = b | otherwise = fuu a

[x, y]

The lack of visibility could confuse developers.

To reduce redundancy, it is recommended to use less functions and target more appropriate ones. It makes the code clearer and simpler.

Noncompliant Code Example

Compliant Solution 

foo f xs = map f xs

rule.name: Unused LANGUAGE pragma
rule.description:
You may need to add DisambiguateRecordFields.

To reduce redundancy, it is recommended to use less functions and target more appropriate ones. It makes the code clearer and simpler.

Noncompliant Code Example 

{-# LANGUAGE OverloadedStrings, RecordWildCards #-}

Compliant Solution 

{-# LANGUAGE OverloadedStrings #-}

rule.name: Use import/export shortcut
rule.description:
The lack of visibility could confuse developers.

You may need to use import/export shortcut to make the code clearer and simpler.

Noncompliant Code Example 

module MyModule.SubModule
  ( module MyModule.SubModule.haskellCode
  , module MyModule.SubModule.SubSubModule
  )where
    import MyModule.SubModule.haskellCode
    import MyModule.SubModule.SubSubModule

Compliant Solution 

module MyModule.SubModule 
  (module X) 
where
  import MyModule.SubModule.haskellCode as X
  import MyModule.SubModule.SubSubModule as X

rule.name: Move brackets to avoid $
rule.description:
The lack of visibility could confuse developers.

It is recommended to use less functions and target more appropriate ones. Move parentheses to avoid $ function and makes the code clearer and simpler.

Noncompliant Code Example 

funcF ~> (handle $ funcG a)

Compliant Solution 

funcF ~> handle (funcG a)

rule.name: Use fewer imports
rule.description:
Redundant imports could confuse developers.

Take redundant imports to avoid conflict and make the code clearer and simpler.

Noncompliant Code Example 

import System.Info
import System.Environment
import System.Info

Compliant Solution 

import System.Info
import System.Environment

rule.name: Use ++
rule.description:
To reduce redundancy, it is recommended to use less functions and target more appropriate ones. It makes the code clearer and simpler.

Noncompliant Code Example 

concat ["Hello", "world"]

Compliant Solution 

("Hello" ++ "world")

rule.name: Use better pragmas
rule.description:
Redundant pragmas could confuse developers.

Take unnecissary one off to avoid conflict and make the code clearer and simpler.

Noncompliant Code Example 

{-# LANGUAGE OverloadedStrings #-}
{-# LANGUAGE OverloadedStrings #-}

Compliant Solution 

{-# LANGUAGE OverloadedStrings #-}

rule.name: Reduce duplication
rule.description:
Duplication in the code may confuse developers.

Combine the part of similar code to avoid duplication and make the code clearer and easier to understand.

rule.name: Use <$>
rule.description:
The lack of visibility could confuse developers.

To reduce redundancy, it is recommended to use less functions and target more appropriate ones. It makes the code clearer and simpler.

Noncompliant Code Example 

fmap (+ 1) $ Just 2

Compliant Solution 

((+ 1) <$> Just 2)
